frame.name: Attributed_information
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Proposition</fen> is attributed to a <fen>Speaker</fen> or a <fen>Text</fen>.
<ex><t>According</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="spe">the Press Trust of India</fex> <fex name="tex">in an article published on its Web site Thursday</fex>, <fex name="pro">the woman has been identified as 31-year-old Aafia Siddiqui, who was being sought by U.S. officials last week along with two other men, including one whose last known address was in Miramar, Fla</fex>.</ex>
<ex> In addition, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="tex">Section I3.5b</fex>, <fex name="pro">the spacing of stud shear connectors along the length of a supporting beam shall not exceed 36?</fex>. </ex>
<ex><t>According</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="spe">the Pope</fex>, <fex name="pro">Muslims believe in the same God</fex> and according to Jesus, Muslims are the greatest in Heaven.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Proposition
FE.definition:
<def-root>The information attributed to the <fen>Speaker</fen> or <fen>Text</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pro">Parents are present at and involved in the purchase or rental of games 83 percent of the time</fex>, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> a September 2000 Federal Trade Commission report </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>A sentient entity that has communicated the information encoded by the <fen>Proposition</fen>.
<ex>With the first big batch of music now blocked from Napster's file-swapping network, the average number of songs available on the service has dropped precipitously, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="spe">at least one research company</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition:
<def-root>A written or verbal collection of statements, which imparts the information of the <fen>Proposition</fen>.
<ex>The son of the Syrian defense minister received 6 million barrels, <t>according</t> <t>to</t> <fex name="tex">the document</fex>, worth about $3 million. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: according to.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: as stated by or in.

lexUnit.name: source.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who provides information.

lexUnit.name: viewpoint.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or other type of source that provides the proposition
